Description: Fruits is cultivated in Malnad / Western Ghats. It is important locally for food and income and adapted to local climate and soils. Major producing districts include Chikkamagaluru, Kodagu, Shivamogga.
How_to_Grow:
1. Soil type (ಮಣ್ಣು): humus-rich loam ಮಣ್ಣು (ಹ್ಯೂಮಸ್-ಸಂಪನ್ನ ಮಣ್ಣು) on slopes; ensure good drainage.

2. Land preparation (ನೆಲ ಸಿದ್ಧತೆ): Plough 2–3 times, remove weeds and level the field. Incorporate well-rotted farmyard manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ) or compost into the topsoil.

3. Sowing time (ಬಿತ್ತನೆ ಸಮಯ): High rainfall area — plant after the heavy rains settle to avoid seed/seedling washout.

4. Seed rate & spacing (ಬೀಜ ಪ್ರಮಾಣ ಮತ್ತು ಅಂತರ): Use recommended seed rates from KVK/UAS.

5. Fertilizer & manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ ಮತ್ತು ಎರೆವು): Apply FYM and balanced NPK based on soil test.

6. Watering schedule (ನೀರಾವರಿ): Water as per crop stage; use drip ನೀರಾವರಿ where possible.

7. Weeding and interculture (ಕೊಳೆ ತೆಗೆಯುವುದು): Timely weeding and mulching helps conserve moisture.

8. Pest & disease control (ಕೀಟ/ರೋಗ): Follow IPM and use neem-based (ನಿಂಬೆ) biopesticides for minor pests.

9. Harvesting (ಕೊಯ್ದು): Harvest at maturity and dry/store properly.
Economic_Importance: Fruits supports local food and income needs in Malnad / Western Ghats; market value depends on quality and access to buyers.
Uses: Used for food, feed or processing depending on crop; residues generally returned to soil as mulch or used as fodder.
YouTube_Links: KVK / ICAR YouTube playlist – general crop practices: https://www.youtube.com/user/ICARDARESEARCH
Article_Links: KVK or Agri extension article portal (search specific crop): https://kvk.icar.gov.in/

7. Weeding and interculture (ಕೊಳೆ ತೆಗೆಯುವುದು): Timely weeding and mulching helps conserve moisture.

8. Pest & disease control (ಕೀಟ/ರೋಗ): Follow IPM and use neem-based (ನಿಂಬೆ) biopesticides for minor pests.

9. Harvesting (ಕೊಯ್ದು): Harvest at maturity and dry/store properly.
Economic_Importance: Paddy (rice) in valleys supports local food and income needs in Malnad / Western Ghats; market value depends on quality and access to buyers.
Uses: Used for food, feed or processing depending on crop; residues generally returned to soil as mulch or used as fodder.

Article_Links: KVK or Agri extension article portal (search specific crop): https://kvk.icar.gov.in/

Description: Coconut (Cocos nucifera) is cultivated in Malnad / Western Ghats. It is important locally for food and income and adapted to local climate and soils. Major producing districts include Chikkamagaluru, Kodagu, Shivamogga.
How_to_Grow:
1. Soil type (ಮಣ್ಣು): humus-rich loam ಮಣ್ಣು (ಹ್ಯೂಮಸ್-ಸಂಪನ್ನ ಮಣ್ಣು) on slopes; ensure good drainage.

2. Land preparation (ನೆಲ ಸಿದ್ಧತೆ): Plough 2–3 times, remove weeds and level the field. Incorporate well-rotted farmyard manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ) or compost into the topsoil.

3. Sowing time (ಬಿತ್ತನೆ ಸಮಯ): High rainfall area — plant after the heavy rains settle to avoid seed/seedling washout.

4. Seed rate & spacing (ಬೀಜ ಪ್ರಮಾಣ ಮತ್ತು ಅಂತರ): Use recommended seed rates from KVK/UAS.

5. Fertilizer & manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ ಮತ್ತು ಎರೆವು): Apply FYM and balanced NPK based on soil test.

6. Watering schedule (ನೀರಾವರಿ): Water as per crop stage; use drip ನೀರಾವರಿ where possible.

7. Weeding and interculture (ಕೊಳೆ ತೆಗೆಯುವುದು): Timely weeding and mulching helps conserve moisture.

8. Pest & disease control (ಕೀಟ/ರೋಗ): Follow IPM and use neem-based (ನಿಂಬೆ) biopesticides for minor pests.

9. Harvesting (ಕೊಯ್ದು): Harvest at maturity and dry/store properly.
Economic_Importance: Coconut supports local food and income needs in Malnad / Western Ghats; market value depends on quality and access to buyers.
Uses: Used for food, feed or processing depending on crop; residues generally returned to soil as mulch or used as fodder.
